text:
Nick Schwartz

USA TODAY Sports

Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will tie the knot Saturday at Windsor Castle in what will be the wedding event of the year. So, when should you tune in?

The Royal Wedding ceremony will begin at 7:00 a.m. ET Saturday.

Televised coverage of the wedding will begin at 4:00 a.m. ET on CBS, and continue later on just about every network imaginable. You can choose to watch on NBC, CBS, ABC, CNN, PBS, Fox News, HBO... The list goes on.

Our own Royal expert Hemal Jhaveri reports that the best part is watching everyone arrive, so you might want to wake up early.

You can stream the wedding on YouTube or USATODAY.com

Check out more of our Royal Wedding Week coverage:
